title: How to Answer a Question on Stack Overflow

steps.headline: Click on Questions.
steps.description: You can then sort by newest, featured, frequently asked, questions that need voting, questions that are active, and questions that don't yet have an answer. If you don't find a question that you want to answer, consider searching by tag instead. By searching for a particular tag, you can find questions that are best suited to what you know a lot about.

steps.headline: Find a question that you think you can answer well.
steps.description: Click on the title of the question you want to answer. The question is listed in blue.

steps.headline: Read the question carefully, as well as other answers that have already been posted.
steps.description: Figure out if you have any additional, relevant information to add.

steps.headline: Scroll down to see the answer box.
steps.description: Fill in your answer. You can add formatting including bold, italics, links, and images to enhance your answer.

steps.headline: When you are finished, click on the 'Post your answer' button.
steps.description: The page will reload and your answer should show up in the next few minutes. If you need help formatting your answer visit Stack Overflow's editing help page here: http://stackoverflow.com/editing-help

steps.headline: Once you have posted your answer, consider finding another question by clicking on a related tag, or re-searching the question page.

text: Visit the Stack Overflow  website.  Click on Questions. You can then sort by newest, featured, frequently asked, questions that need voting, questions that are active, and questions that don't yet have an answer. If you don't find a question that you want to answer, consider searching by tag instead. By searching for a particular tag, you can find questions that are best suited to what you know a lot about. Find a question that you think you can answer well. Click on the title of the question you want to answer. The question is listed in blue. Read the question carefully, as well as other answers that have already been posted. Figure out if you have any additional, relevant information to add. Scroll down to see the answer box. Fill in your answer. You can add formatting including bold, italics, links, and images to enhance your answer. When you are finished, click on the 'Post your answer' button. The page will reload and your answer should show up in the next few minutes. If you need help formatting your answer visit Stack Overflow's editing help page here: http://stackoverflow.com/editing-help Once you have posted your answer, consider finding another question by clicking on a related tag, or re-searching the question page.
sentences: You can then sort by newest, featured, frequently asked, questions that need voting, questions that are active, and questions that don't yet have an answer.
If you don't find a question that you want to answer, consider searching by tag instead.
By searching for a particular tag, you can find questions that are best suited to what you know a lot about.
Find a question that you think you can answer well.
Click on the title of the question you want to answer.
The question is listed in blue.
Read the question carefully, as well as other answers that have already been posted.
Figure out if you have any additional, relevant information to add.
Scroll down to see the answer box.
You can add formatting including bold, italics, links, and images to enhance your answer.
When you are finished, click on the 'Post your answer' button.
The page will reload and your answer should show up in the next few minutes.

If you need help formatting your answer visit Stack Overflow's editing help page here: http://stackoverflow.com/editing-help Once you have posted your answer, consider finding another question by clicking on a related tag, or re-searching the question page.
